segment.source: Deploy a Custom Image
segment.target: Deploy a Custom Image

segment.source: Deploy a Custom Image
segment.target: Deploy a Custom Image

segment.source: Deploy a Custom Image
segment.target: Deploy a Custom Image

segment.source: In this topic you create a reference installation, capture an image of the installation, and rerun Windows® Setup with an answer file that points to your custom image.
segment.target: In this topic you create a reference installation, capture an image of the installation, and rerun Windows® Setup with an answer file that points to your custom image.

segment.source: Deploying a custom image using Windows Setup provides several benefits over applying an image using an image capture tool.
segment.target: Deploying a custom image using Windows Setup provides several benefits over applying an image using an image capture tool.

segment.source: Setup supports the following:
segment.target: Setup supports the following:

segment.source: Applying another answer file for additional customizations during deployment.
segment.target: Applying another answer file for additional customizations during deployment.

segment.source: Reconfiguring disk configuration.
segment.target: Reconfiguring disk configuration.

segment.source: Adding additional drivers.
segment.target: Adding additional drivers.

segment.source: Replacing a product key.
segment.target: Replacing a product key.

segment.source: Selecting a different language to install.
segment.target: Selecting a different language to install.

segment.source: Selecting from a list of images to install, if your image file contains more than one image.
segment.target: Selecting from a list of images to install, if your image file contains more than one image.

segment.source: Installing to a different drive location.
segment.target: Installing to a different drive location.

segment.source: Upgrading an existing Windows installation.
segment.target: Upgrading an existing Windows installation.

segment.source: Configuring the computer to dual-boot operating systems.
segment.target: Configuring the computer to dual-boot operating systems.

segment.source: Ensuring that the hardware can support Windows 8.
segment.target: Ensuring that the hardware can support Windows 8.

segment.source: There are some limitations to installing a custom image using Windows Setup.
segment.target: There are some limitations to installing a custom image using Windows Setup.

segment.source: For more information, see Windows Setup Scenarios and Best Practices.
segment.target: For more information, see Windows Setup Scenarios and Best Practices.

segment.source: In this topic:
segment.target: In this topic:

segment.source: Copy the Windows product DVD source files to a network share
segment.target: Copy the Windows product DVD source files to a network share

segment.source: Create a master installation
segment.target: Create a master installation

segment.source: Capture an image of the installation
segment.target: Capture an image of the installation

segment.source: Create a custom answer file
segment.target: Create a custom answer file

segment.source: Deploy the image by using Windows Setup
segment.target: Deploy the image by using Windows Setup

segment.source: Prerequisites
segment.target: Prerequisites

segment.source: To complete this walkthrough, you need the following:
segment.target: To complete this walkthrough, you need the following:

segment.source: A technician computer.
segment.target: A technician computer.

segment.source: A technician computer is any computer that has the Windows Assessment and Deployment Kit (Windows ADK) tools installed..
segment.target: A technician computer is any computer that has the Windows Assessment and Deployment Kit (Windows ADK) tools installed..

segment.source: A Windows 8 product DVD.
segment.target: A Windows 8 product DVD.

segment.source: A master computer on which you will install and capture your custom image.
segment.target: A master computer on which you will install and capture your custom image.

segment.source: Bootable Windows PE media.
segment.target: Bootable Windows PE media.

segment.source: There are several types of Windows PE media that you can create.
segment.target: There are several types of Windows PE media that you can create.

segment.source: For more information about these options, see WinPE for Windows 10.
segment.target: For more information about these options, see WinPE for Windows 10.

segment.source: Access to a network share to store your custom image and Windows Setup source files.
segment.target: Access to a network share to store your custom image and Windows Setup source files.

segment.source: Step 1: Copy the Windows product DVD source files to a network share
segment.target: Step 1: Copy the Windows product DVD source files to a network share

segment.source: On your technician computer, copy the entire content of the Windows product DVD to a network share.
segment.target: On your technician computer, copy the entire content of the Windows product DVD to a network share.

segment.source: For example:
segment.target: For example:

segment.source: where D: is the DVD-ROM drive on your local computer.
segment.target: where D: is the DVD-ROM drive on your local computer.

segment.source: Step 2: Create a master installation
segment.target: Step 2: Create a master installation

segment.source: Create a master installation by using one of the following methods:
segment.target: Create a master installation by using one of the following methods:

segment.source: Boot from a DVD
segment.target: Boot from a DVD

segment.source: Use a Configuration Set with Windows Setup
segment.target: Use a Configuration Set with Windows Setup

segment.source: After the installation is complete, shut down the computer.
segment.target: After the installation is complete, shut down the computer.

segment.source: Step 3: Capture an image of the installation
segment.target: Step 3: Capture an image of the installation

segment.source: In this step, you will capture an image of the reference installation by using the Deployment Image Servicing and Management (DISM) tool and then store the custom image on a network share.
segment.target: In this step, you will capture an image of the reference installation by using the Deployment Image Servicing and Management (DISM) tool and then store the custom image on a network share.

segment.source: Boot the reference computer by using your bootable Windows PE media.
segment.target: Boot the reference computer by using your bootable Windows PE media.

segment.source: At a command prompt, capture an image of the installation.
segment.target: At a command prompt, capture an image of the installation.

segment.source: You specify a name and description as part of your image capture.
segment.target: You specify a name and description as part of your image capture.

segment.source: All values are required by Windows Setup.
segment.target: All values are required by Windows Setup.

segment.source: If a .wim file does not include these values, then the image will not install correctly.
segment.target: If a .wim file does not include these values, then the image will not install correctly.

segment.source: For example:
segment.target: For example:

segment.source: Replace the default Install.wim on the network share with your custom image.
segment.target: Replace the default Install.wim on the network share with your custom image.

segment.source: The image must be called Install.wim.
segment.target: The image must be called Install.wim.

segment.source: For example:
segment.target: For example:

segment.source: If necessary, provide network credentials for appropriate network access.
segment.target: If necessary, provide network credentials for appropriate network access.

segment.source: For more information, see DISM Image Management Command-Line Options.
segment.target: For more information, see DISM Image Management Command-Line Options.

segment.source: Step 4: Create a custom answer file
segment.target: Step 4: Create a custom answer file

segment.source: In this step, you will create an answer file that points to your custom image.
segment.target: In this step, you will create an answer file that points to your custom image.

segment.source: This step assumes that you have already built an answer file and have a working catalog.
segment.target: This step assumes that you have already built an answer file and have a working catalog.

segment.source: On your technician computer, open Windows System Image Manager.
segment.target: On your technician computer, open Windows System Image Manager.

segment.source: On the File menu, click New Answer File.
segment.target: On the File menu, click New Answer File.

segment.source: In the Windows Image pane of Windows SIM, expand the Components node to display available settings.
segment.target: In the Windows Image pane of Windows SIM, expand the Components node to display available settings.

segment.source: Add the following components to your answer file by right-clicking the component and then selecting the appropriate configuration pass.
segment.target: Add the following components to your answer file by right-clicking the component and then selecting the appropriate configuration pass.

segment.source: Component
segment.target: Component

segment.source: Configuration Pass
segment.target: Configuration Pass

segment.source: Microsoft-Windows-Setup\DiskConfiguration\Disk\CreatePartitions\ CreatePartition
segment.target: Microsoft-Windows-Setup\DiskConfiguration\Disk\CreatePartitions\ CreatePartition

segment.source: windowsPE
segment.target: windowsPE

segment.source: Microsoft-Windows-Setup\DiskConfiguration\Disk\ModifyPartitions\ ModifyPartition
segment.target: Microsoft-Windows-Setup\DiskConfiguration\Disk\ModifyPartitions\ ModifyPartition

segment.source: windowsPE
segment.target: windowsPE

segment.source: Microsoft-Windows-Setup\ImageInstall\OSImage\InstallTo
segment.target: Microsoft-Windows-Setup\ImageInstall\OSImage\InstallTo

segment.source: windowsPE
segment.target: windowsPE

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Expand the component list until you see the lowest setting listed in the previous table, and then add that setting to your answer file.
segment.target: Expand the component list until you see the lowest setting listed in the previous table, and then add that setting to your answer file.

segment.source: This shortcut will add the setting and all parent settings to your answer file in one step.
segment.target: This shortcut will add the setting and all parent settings to your answer file in one step.

segment.source: All of the settings that you added must appear in the Answer File pane.
segment.target: All of the settings that you added must appear in the Answer File pane.

segment.source: Select and configure each setting as specified in the following table.
segment.target: Select and configure each setting as specified in the following table.

segment.source: Component
segment.target: Component

segment.source: Value
segment.target: Value

segment.source: Microsoft-Windows-Setup\DiskConfiguration
segment.target: Microsoft-Windows-Setup\DiskConfiguration

segment.source: Microsoft-Windows-Setup\DiskConfiguration\Disk
segment.target: Microsoft-Windows-Setup\DiskConfiguration\Disk

segment.source: Microsoft-Windows-Setup\DiskConfiguration\Disk\CreatePartitions\CreatePartition
segment.target: Microsoft-Windows-Setup\DiskConfiguration\Disk\CreatePartitions\CreatePartition

segment.source: Microsoft-Windows-Setup\DiskConfiguration\Disk\CreatePartitions\CreatePartition
segment.target: Microsoft-Windows-Setup\DiskConfiguration\Disk\CreatePartitions\CreatePartition

segment.source: Microsoft-Windows-Setup\DiskConfiguration\Disk\ModifyPartitions\ModifyPartition
segment.target: Microsoft-Windows-Setup\DiskConfiguration\Disk\ModifyPartitions\ModifyPartition

segment.source: Microsoft-Windows-Setup\DiskConfiguration\Disk\ModifyPartitions\ModifyPartition
segment.target: Microsoft-Windows-Setup\DiskConfiguration\Disk\ModifyPartitions\ModifyPartition

segment.source: Microsoft-Windows-Setup\ImageInstall\OSImage/strong>
segment.target: Microsoft-Windows-Setup\ImageInstall\OSImage/strong>

segment.source: Microsoft-Windows-Setup\ImageInstall\OSImage\InstallTo
segment.target: Microsoft-Windows-Setup\ImageInstall\OSImage\InstallTo

segment.source: In a command prompt window copy the answer file to a network location.
segment.target: In a command prompt window copy the answer file to a network location.

segment.source: For example:
segment.target: For example:

segment.source: If necessary, provide network credentials for appropriate network access.
segment.target: If necessary, provide network credentials for appropriate network access.

segment.source: Step 5: Deploy the image by using Windows Setup
segment.target: Step 5: Deploy the image by using Windows Setup

segment.source: In this step, you will deploy your custom image from a network share onto a destination computer.
segment.target: In this step, you will deploy your custom image from a network share onto a destination computer.

segment.source: Boot the destination computer by using your bootable Windows PE media.
segment.target: Boot the destination computer by using your bootable Windows PE media.

segment.source: Connect to the network share that you specified in Step 4: Create a custom answer file, and then run Setup with your answer file.
segment.target: Connect to the network share that you specified in Step 4: Create a custom answer file, and then run Setup with your answer file.

segment.source: For example:
segment.target: For example:

segment.source: If necessary, provide network credentials for appropriate network access.
segment.target: If necessary, provide network credentials for appropriate network access.

segment.source: Next Steps
segment.target: Next Steps

segment.source: You can further customize your answer file to include additional options.
segment.target: You can further customize your answer file to include additional options.

segment.source: You can also build a DVD deployment media that contains the same content that you put on the network share.
segment.target: You can also build a DVD deployment media that contains the same content that you put on the network share.

segment.source: A single deployment DVD provides a portable installation solution that requires no network or any additional resources.
segment.target: A single deployment DVD provides a portable installation solution that requires no network or any additional resources.

segment.source: The process includes building a configuration set and recapturing all source files into a single DVD.
segment.target: The process includes building a configuration set and recapturing all source files into a single DVD.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: The DVD media that you create is for internal deployment use only.
segment.target: The DVD media that you create is for internal deployment use only.

segment.source: You cannot redistribute this media.
segment.target: You cannot redistribute this media.
